comment.author: 62379908@N00
comment._content:
I can see a dozen people, possibly 13 if the older lady has an infant on her lap.  There are three bicycles.  This would be around 1910 to 1920, based on the style of the clothing and the bicycles.  This is the back porch of a large house and single story part is probably an addition.  It is likely to be a kitchen.  A century or more ago, kitchens were often connected to the house by a breezeway.  After about 1900, they began to attach them to the house.  The idea was to keep kitchen heat out of the main house in summer.  Cooking was done on a cast iron wood stove that produced a lot of excess heat.  I also notice the "dinner bell" which was common in rural areas and was used to call field hands in for meals.  Most of them were old bells salvaged from trains.  The chimney in the center of the roof indicates that it was for a stove.  A fireplace would have been at the end of the room.
Notice early "clothes dryer" at left.

comment.author: 34586311@N05
comment._content: This is wonderful information Howard33 -- thanks for adding so many great details to the scene!
